critique: The document is an executive order regarding the operation of the Panama Canal. As the President, the primary emotion I want to elicit is a sense of confidence and stability. The order aims to ensure the smooth operation and control of the Canal Zone, likely in response to some perceived threat or instability. The tone is authoritative and decisive, reflecting a need for immediate action. The language is formal and legalistic, emphasizing the seriousness and binding nature of the order. There is a sense of urgency conveyed by the phrase "until otherwise ordered."
